turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I appreciate the fact that you worry about me, but don't.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Okay, we won't.  We'll just have fun, all agreed?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: What are they saying?

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: I don't know.  I flunked Spanish.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: Come on down!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You go ahead...

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Your bed.

turns.speaker: DEBBIE
turns.text: A hammock?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Have you ever made love in a hammock?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Derek... stop.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You know what I've been through. Don't ever scare me like that.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I just wanted to surprise you.  What can I say?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You can say... "Hello, how are you?"... for starters.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Hello.  How are you?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You haven't changed a bit.  Always so sure of yourself.  Even when we were kids, when you wanted something, nothing could stop you.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Is that so bad?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You're irresistible.  I lose control.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Just slow down.  Let me get to know you again.  Let me get to know this place again.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Okay.  There's a whole weekend ahead of us.  There's time.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: This door was open just a minute ago, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Look what I found.  Remember these?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Did you stay here last night?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: No.  I got here just before you did.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Somebody was in here.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Goldilocks and the Three Bears?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I'm serious.  Doesn't this look a little strange to you?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Shelly!  Where are you?!

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Are you all right, Shelly?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Let's spread out and check all the rooms.  Outside, too.  You stay with me.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: No.  I can look around by myself. I'll take the upstairs.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: This is too painful to look at.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Why don't we drive over to the cove and watch the sunset.  It'll mellow you out.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You know, I'm not sure I could live anywhere else.  The nights are always so peaceful and quiet.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: It's deceiving.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: The quiet can fool you.  It fooled me.  You can never be sure of what's out there.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Why did you come back here?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: ... To prove something to myself... to prove I'm stronger than I think I am.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: And, what about us?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I'm here with you.  Can't that be enough for now?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I don't know.  I don't see you for months on end, and when I do, you put this wall between us.  How do I break through?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: I'm trying.  I'm really trying.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What happened that night?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: You promised you'd never ask me.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: After you left me that night, I didn't see you or talk to you again for a year.  No one would tell me anything.  All I know is what the police told me.  We have nowhere to go unless you let me in.  What happened?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: When you dropped me off at the house, it was very late.  My parents were waiting up for me. As soon as I got in the door, they starting yelling and cursing at me.  I was so upset... I told them I slept with you.  My mothers slapped me.  That was the first time she'd ever hit me.  I couldn't believe it.  I ran out of the house and into the woods as fast and as far as I could run. I was crying.  They had destroyed the most beautiful night of my life and I wanted to punish them for that.  I decided to hide out all night.  They'd be so worried that they'd be sorry for what they did to me.  The woods were cold and damp from the rain.  I found a dry spot under a rotted oak tree and I guess I fell asleep.  All I can remember next is being startled out of sleep by the sound of footsteps.  I thought it was my father so I hid behind the tree. But the footsteps just stopped. The woods were dark.  I couldn't see anything.  I heard a cracking noise behind me.  I turned around and... and... oh, God... there was this hideous looking man.  So grotesque he was almost inhuman.  He had a knife and he started to slash away at me, again and again.  I was so hysterical and I don't know how I was able to get away.  I ran and ran, but he kept coming.  He was big but so fast.  He caught me and pulled me down to the ground and he... he... ripped my blouse off. I was screaming, but who could hear me?  Then... oh, God... he dragged me by the hair along the ground.  I was kicking and yelling.  He dragged me deeper and deeper into the woods.  Oh, please... please...

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's all right, you're all right. I'm with you.

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Could we move a little faster?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Sure, just watch where you're going.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You know him?

turns.speaker: CHRIS
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: You're Shelly?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: What d'ya got in there?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: My whole world.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: In that little thing?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Stick around and you'll see.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: What are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Destroy the evidence, Pronto!

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Faster!  Eat faster!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Why don't you help us?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Uh... I guess I'm just not hungry.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: That scarecrow?  Can't you tell how weird his is just by looking at him.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Come on, Shelly.  Who else is gonna give him a lift?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Not us!  He's really creepy.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Is... is everything all right?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Everything's gonna be fine.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Excuse me, but I believe that's mine...

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Please... be cool.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: May be please have the wallet.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Are they following us?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Gulp!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: See anything?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Just a dirty window.  Next time, I'll know how to handle a situation like that.  Let's just hope that "next time" isn't too soon.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Stop worrying.  I don't think they'll bother to come after us.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Keep looking.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Got any good ideas?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: This is no time to celebrate!

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Just keep your eyes on the road.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: What're you doing?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: No time to explain.  Just listen. When I yell "stop," you jam on the brakes as hard as you can.  Okay?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: You're the boss.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Bullseye!

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Stop the car!  Now!!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: This has been on helluva beginning to a quiet weekend in the country.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Look at it this way... things can only get better... Right?

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: We had a slight misunderstanding with that motorcycle gang...  ... but Shelly made them see the error of their ways.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: It was nothing.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: We're really sorry, but it wasn't our fault.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: A few minor repairs and it'll be as good as new.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Vera... you and I have had a chance to really get to know one another today.  I like you... very much.  I was thinking that maybe.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Don't say any more.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: You've just learned a valuable lesson.  A beautiful girl like you should never go out in the dark alone.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Damn you, Shelly!

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: Why do you do these stupid things?!

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I have to.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: You don't "have to."

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I just want you to like me.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: I do like you.  But not when you act like a jerk.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Being a jerk is better than being nothing.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: I never said you were "nothing".

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: You don't to say it.  I can tell.

turns.speaker: VERA
turns.text: You're wrong.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: I thought that was the end of the song.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Great.  Just great.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: If this thing is burned out, friggin' Horace will ground my butt.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: Who's Horace?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: My friggin' stepfather and asshole- in-residence.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Go out and plug the cord back in.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: What?  Who pulled it out?!

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: Will you hurry up!  I gotta get this fuckmobile back before Horace finds out I took it.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: Alright, alright.

turns.speaker: JILL
turns.text: That's it.  Pull over.  I'm drivin'.

turns.speaker: CORT
turns.text: No way...  ...I wanna rock!

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Will you slow down?  It's hard enough to read this thing.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: Well, who told me to take this cow path?

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: You admit the sign did say "Camp Forest Green," with an arrow pointing this way.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: I admit nothing without talking to my lawyer.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: Darren, we better turn around.

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: Why?  Because I've seen enough horror movies to know masked weirdos are never friendly.

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Yeah... We're gonna scare him.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: We're gonna scare him?!

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: That's right.  Just drive toward him.  He'll move.  Nobody wants to die.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: That's a freakin' fact.  Least of all us.

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Just drive.  He'll get out of our way.

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Oh, jeez.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: That's it.  We're driving this baby back to town... in reverse.

turns.speaker: DARREN
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  Just stay cool.

turns.speaker: LIZBETH
turns.text: Stay cool?  You ain't Dirty Harry. Now stop it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: It's kinda frightening to think that a kid like that can go so far over the edge.  Jason really screwed up the poor sonofabitch's mind.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: He really believes Jason's still alive, doesn't he?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: But that's no what worries me the most...It's how far he'll go to try and prove it.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: I'm getting real tired of this maniac.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: Maybe we better call that psychiatric clinic.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Better call an ambulance first.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Is that all you found?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: I wish it was.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Better get out the Hefty Bags... Looks like our boy desperately wants us to believe his story.

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: He sure chose the right day to pull this shit.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Whaddya mean?

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: Happy Friday the 13th.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You just sit tight, Jason.  Once the authorities from Carpenter get here, you'll...

turns.speaker: DEPUTY
turns.text: Sheriff, you better take this.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: ....with a woman's touch.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Now wait a second!  I thought Burt shot you.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: See any paint?...  ...Sorry, guys, I did in Mr. Commando.  Survival is the name of the game, and that flag is mine.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: Come on, you guys!  The game's over!!

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: You don't know for sure.  What about Roy?  Nobody's seen him.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: Of course not.  If he hasn't already accidentally pelleted himself, I'm sure he's lost.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Yeah, but the game's not over until it's over.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Ahh, nothing.

turns.speaker: KATIE
turns.text: I could swear I heard...

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Once we nail Roy, that's it. Victory is ours.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: This is taking forever.  I'm starving.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: That's your problem, Larry. That's why your sales are always below quota.  Your instinct to eat is stronger than your instinct to win.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: My ass.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: Yeah, that's fat too.

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: You become a whole other person when you're out here, Stan.  And I don't like it.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: This is a man's game.  Requiring a man's cunning and intelligence...

turns.speaker: LARRY
turns.text: Never should've let her play.

turns.speaker: STAN
turns.text: It's a damn company executive game, and she's a damn company exec.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Come on, Dad.  You could have Rick drive down Cunningham Road and look for them.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Megan, my deputies have more important things to do than look for camp counselors with car trouble.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Jason who?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Megan, get away from him.  He's dangerous.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: But, Dad, we...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Megan, take your friends back to the camp.  I'll let you know if I hear anything about your counselors.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: When are you going to stop treating me like one!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: When you stop acting like one... Tommy Jarvis is a very sick boy. And you...

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: How do you know?  Did you take his temperature?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: You watch that smart-mouthing, young lady.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: What it is?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Not what...who.  Seems your boyfriend wants people to believe Jason has returned.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: I thought Jason was only a legend?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: He is.  Only Tommy wants to prove the legend is true...  ...You stay put.  And I'm not kidding.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: ...And I said, shut up!

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: All he's asking is for you to check it out.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Can't you at least call the camp and make sure everything's all right?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: We have!  Trying to track you down.  The phone there is disconnected.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Rick.  Keep and eye on our wacko kid.  I'll be back as soon as I can.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Daddy, what is going on?

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: And make sure my daughter stays put...  ...She's grounded.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: No.  No, it's not...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Yes, Megan.  Tommy Jarvis is a killer.  A very deranged boy who wants you to believe that...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yeah, hi.  Listen, I've got to talk to your dad.  About Jason. I've got a plan.  I need to buy some things first but mainly need help to...

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Tommy, my father is out looking for you right now.  Something happened tonight and he's sure you're responsible.  If he finds you, he'll...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I already have a very good idea what could've happened...  ...Megan, Jason is out there.  He has to be stopped.  I'm positive he's heading back to the lake area.  He'll keep killing until...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Hide it behind the gas station. Then we can get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Didn't you say you needed some supplies to do this?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Uh...yes.  But...

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Then let's get goin'.  We can argue on the way.  You tell me what you need...  ...I'll make sure you get in.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: You got it.  Just keep an eye out for roadblocks.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Okay.  There's one.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: It's all over.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: It's just beginning.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: So what are ya drawin'?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: What's it to ya?

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: There...Ya happy?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: 'Cause it stinks.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Okay, give it back.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Come and get it.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Sorry, Megan.  Not this time.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Wait a minute. I just...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I thank you for getting me out. But I gotta finish what I started.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Are you sure this is gonna work? I mean, why didn't we bring that gun and just blast him away?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: It probably wouldn't have any effect on him.  The only sure way to stop Jason is to return him to his original resting place, where he drowned in 1957.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Lake Forest Green?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Crystal Lake...where the nightmare began.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: They did show up.  Isn't that great?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I hope so.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Whew...Okay, hand me those padlocks.

turns.speaker: MEGAN
turns.text: Did you hear me?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yes.  And I said, hand me those padlocks.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: So what happened?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: There was this monster.  He was after me.  He wanted to kill me.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You mean you had a bad dream.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No, he was real.  Like on TV.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Okay, listen...what's your name, sweetie?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Nancy.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Well, Nancy, I'm Paula... remember?  This is Sissy, and we're gonna be right out there all night so nothing can hurt you. Okay?...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: ...Good.  So no more bad dreams can come around here, huh?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No more.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Where'd you get this?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I found it outside.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You know what?  Sissy and Cort are playing jokes.  You know, trying to scare each other.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Well, grown-ups think it's funny to be scared.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Are they grown-ups?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: That's debatable.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I can't believe no one called back.  I better...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Who ya calling?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: But what if they try and scare us?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: We'll scare 'em right back.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I'm sure Cort and Sissy are back in their cabins.  So you just go back to sleep and don't worry.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: But what I get scared again?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Shhh...You know what I used to do when I was a little girl when I got scared?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: It's just that Darren and Lizbeth are in charge of organizing and setting up the new campgrounds.

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: All the little kids arrive today. We're not ready to deal with that alone.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: So where's Cort gone off to?

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Are you ready?  He's taken our young men off to teach them my favorites sport.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Which is?

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Boy scouting.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: You gotta be kidding!

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Okay, okay.  I suggest that the crime was committed in the bedroom, by Colonel Mustard, with the knife.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Huh?  Oh, come on, Sis.  I'm tellin' ya, we can't play Clue with just two people.

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Why not?  I used to play it alone. I love murder games.  Have you ever played The Consulting Detective?

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: No...Did Megan say when she's coming back from her...visit?

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Of course not.  She probably took him a loaf of bread with a saw hidden in it.  I still don't get it.  Why him?  I mean, he's cute alright, but...

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: Hi.  Everything's all right now. We're here.

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Yeah, we're here.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: I just realized something. Where's Cort?  I haven't seen him for hours.

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: I don't know.  He called somebody, then took off.

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: He didn't say anything?

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: Yeah, he was gonna check out "things that go bump in the night."

turns.speaker: PAULA
turns.text: What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: SISSY
turns.text: I think somebody's messin' around out there.

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Now you better cool out a minute, boy.  You already almost got your head blown to pieces.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Will you listen, dammit!

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Don't piss me off, junior.  Or I will repaint this office with your brains.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Jason is alive.  We dug up his body.  I was gonna cremate it and...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Hold it.  Whoa... What's your name, son?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Tommy Jarvis.  We gotta do something.  He's even more powerful now that...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: Aren't you the kid whose mother and friends were....

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yeah.  Jason murdered them and...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: And you've been at some psychiatric clinic ever since, haven't you?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yes, but they released me because...

turns.speaker: SHERIFF
turns.text: No problem, Rick.  Come over and meet a former resident here, Tommy Jarvis.  He's got some kinda prank going about...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: There's no time for this bullshit...
